attributes.action: Change the law  to allow licensed shotgun owners to purchase and use shotguns with larger capacity magazines
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Currently shotguns are restricted to two cartridges (or 2+1 in the breech with semi or pump shotguns). Practical shotgun enthusiasts cannot use this type of artifically restricted shotgun as it is too slow to reload for competition.  

This means a firearms certificate (FAC) is required and the enthusiast must join a rifle club and be a member for 3 to 6 months before being allowed to apply for a FAC.

I propose that all smoothbore shotguns  have the artificial magazine capacity restriction removed and allow licensed shotgun owners to purchase shoguns with a capacity of up to 8 cartridges. 

If a person is deemed responsible enough by the Police to own a shotgun that can hold two cartridges, owning one that is identical in all respects other than  magazine capacity seems a reasonable change to the law to make.

Some advantages to this change would be:

Reduce licensing fees making the sport more accessible to all.

Greatly reduced workload AND cost for both Police forces and gun owners.

Simplified administration for Police as each shotgun won't need specific approval, just registration.

Reduce the number of firearm certificates issued.

Encourage more people to get involved in the sport.
